creditline: Gift of Henry White Cannon Jr., Class of 1910, in memory of his Father

makers.displaymaker: formerly attributed to Angelo Bronzino, Italian, 1503-1572
formerly attributed to Johannes Stradanus, Flemish, 1523–1605

texts.textentryhtml: Jean Paul Richter (1847-1937), Purchased in London in 1907; Purchased from him by Henry White Cannon (1850-1934) in Florence on March 10, 1906; By descent to his son, Henry (Harry) W. Cannon, Jr. (1887-1966), Class of 1910; Donated to the Museum in 1935.

caption: Anonymous, formerly attributed to Johannes Stradanus (Flemish, 1523–1605), Jacopino del Conte (Italian, 1510/15–1598), formerly attributed to Angelo Bronzino (Italian, 1503-1572), Portrait of Luigi Capponi, ca. 1550. Oil on wood panel; 111.8 x 83.8 cm, 134 × 98 × 4 cm (frame). Gift of Henry White Cannon Jr., Class of 1910, in memory of his Father (y1935-59)
